item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Friday, November 29, 2024 at 6:25 AM UTC
item.description:
1. How much memory do you need in 2024 to run 1M concurrent tasks? (112 points | 61 comments)
2. Send someone you appreciate an official 'Continue and Persist' Letter (529 points | 105 comments)
3. BYD launches sodium-ion grid-scale BESS product (39 points | 24 comments)
4. Show HN: Screen Sharing in the Browser–No Downloads, No Registrations (58 points | 8 comments)
5. The UX of Lego Interface Panels (2020) (291 points | 27 comments)
6. Microbenchmarks Are Experiments (25 points | 5 comments)
7. The success and failure of Ninja (2020) (162 points | 32 comments)
8. The trouble with struct sockaddr's fake flexible array (11 points | discuss)
9. A pretty visualisation of the European power grid (2022) (217 points | 108 comments)
10. Australian Parliament bans social media for under-16s with world-first law (44 points | 48 comments)
11. US Antitrust Watchdog Launches Broad Microsoft Investigation (16 points | 3 comments)
12. Tk9.0: CGo-free, cross platform GUI toolkit for Go (174 points | 63 comments)
13. William James and the philosophy of pragmatism (2018) (41 points | 5 comments)
14. Rapid colonization of a space-returned Ryugu sample by terrestrial microorganism (74 points | 26 comments)
15. An Intuitive Explanation of Sparse Autoencoders for LLM Interpretability (24 points | discuss)
16. Show HN: Vince – A self hosted alternative to Google Analytics (9 points | 4 comments)
17. Bootkitty: Analyzing the first UEFI bootkit for Linux (116 points | 47 comments)
18. Mechanical Engineer creates instruments for his one man industrial metal band (26 points | 9 comments)
19. Car tires shed a quarter of all microplastics in the environment (185 points | 170 comments)
20. Multimodal Interpretability in 2024 (5 points | discuss)
21. A new start after 60: I became a 'hummingbird' for people with dementia (100 points | 12 comments)
22. Float Self-Tagging (34 points | 42 comments)
23. Show HN: Indentation-based syntax for Clojure (19 points | 2 comments)
24. Engineers do not get to make startup mistakes when they build ledgers (101 points | 96 comments)
25. Canada Competition Bureau sues Google for anti-competitive conduct in online ads (50 points | 17 comments)
26. Aftershock II (19 points | 2 comments)
27. QwQ: Alibaba's O1-like reasoning LLM (330 points | 237 comments)
28. Hetzner cuts traffic on US VPSs, raises prices (300 points | 528 comments)
29. London's 850-year-old food markets to close (274 points | 216 comments)
30. The great abandonment: what happens to the natural world when people disappear? (58 points | 54 comments)
item.guid: Hacker News Top Stories: Friday, November 29, 2024 at 6:25 AM UTC
